Class Animal

java.lang.Object
simulator.actors.Animal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Actor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Rabbit
public abstract class Animal extends Object implements Actor
Animal is an abstract class that all animals inherit from. It contains some of the default animal behaviour and every method that every animal has in common.

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      public Animal(int startEnergy, int maxAge, Class<? extends NonBlockable> foodType)
      Animal constructor
      Parameters:
      startEnergy - - how much energy an animal has to start off with. This will also be the max energy for that animal
      maxAge - - the oldest an animal can get before dying
      foodType - - what type of food does the animal eat

    • Animal

      public Animal()
      Animal constructor defaults to 100 energy, max age of 10 and grass as its food type

  • Method Details

    • getEnergy

      public int getEnergy()
      Returns the animal's current energy level
      Returns:
      energy level of animal

    • increaseEnergy

      public void increaseEnergy(int amount)
      Increase animals energy. If final amount of energy is higher than the animals max energy, then the animal is simply left with its max energy
      Parameters:
      amount - - the amount of energy the animal gains

    • decreaseEnergy

      public void decreaseEnergy(int amount, World world)
      Decrese energy and age animal. If energy drops to 0 or if the animal's age exceeds its max age, then it dies
      Parameters:
      amount - - the amount of energy the animal loses
      world - - reference to the world

      public void killAnimal(World world)

      protected void wander(World world)
      Random wander behaviour. Animal picks an empty sorrounding tile and goes there.
      Parameters:
      world - - reference to the world
